docs.snippet: President Nixon said yesterday that the United States must have power to raise trade barriers as well as lower them to gain a "fairer shake" for American business in world trade. Mr. Nixon, in a conversation with Treasury Secretary George P. Shultz,...
docs.lead_paragraph: President Nixon said yesterday that the United States must have power to raise trade barriers as well as lower them to gain a "fairer shake" for American business in world trade. Mr. Nixon, in a conversation with Treasury Secretary George P. Shultz, said that the dollar's 10 per cent devaluation was only a first step toward making American goods more competitive in world trade.
docs.abstract: correction on Feb 4 article on recent acquisition of land for new center to house Schomburg Collection of Black Literature and History; firm of Bond Ryder & Associates was chosen as architect for new bldgs by bd of dirs of Schomburg library and approved by NYC's Dept of Public Works but formal contract has not been leased

headline.main: News Summary and Index; The Major Events of the Day. Monetary Situation International National Metropolitan The Other News Quotation of the Day CORRECTION

docs.snippet: Uruguay's armed forces have assumed virtual control of the Government but will remain in the background and preserve the constitutional system. This is the general tenor of the agreement reached yesterday between President Juan Maria Bordaberry and...
docs.lead_paragraph: Uruguay's armed forces have assumed virtual control of the Government but will remain in the background and preserve the constitutional system. This is the general tenor of the agreement reached yesterday between President Juan Maria Bordaberry and the military commanders after a weeklong governmental crisis.
docs.abstract: Uruguay's armed forces, as result of accord reached Feb 12 with Pres Bordaberry, have assumed virtual control of Govt but will remain in background and preserve const system; Natl Security Council to be created as mechanism of mil control over adm; council will be dominated by mil; gen housecleaning to be carried out at demand of armed forces; mil leaders insist they are engaged in nationalist movement and have not looked elsewhere for ideological basis; mil class in Uruguay is traditionaly professional caste with sole objective being to defend country against subversion; comdrs who led challenge to Govt are for most part followers of M Aguerrondo, retired gen who symbolizes mil ideal; operational leader of move to assume more active role in nation's adm said to be Gen E Cristi; chief ideologist said to be Col R Brabal; G Alvares also identified as one of movement's thinkers

headline.main: Uruguay Pact Assures Military Control; Broad Changes Likely

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: "The emergency is over," a spokesman for Uruguay's armed forces declared today, a week after the military defied civilian authority and demanded a greater role in this country's administration.
docs.lead_paragraph: "The emergency is over," a spokesman for Uruguay's armed forces declared today, a week after the military defied civilian authority and demanded a greater role in this country's administration.

headline.main: Uruguay Pressing Drive on Corruption as Crisis Appears Over; Military Hails Accord

docs.snippet: International The United States and North Vietnam announced an agreement yesterday to establish a Joint Economic Commission to channel American aid to North Vietnam. But whether there will be any aid to channel remained in doubt.

headline.main: News Summary and Index; Major Events of the Day The Other News Quotation of the Day CORRECTIONS

docs.snippet: Uruguay has emerged from its worst political crisis in four decades with heavy damage to the democratic system that was once the pride and envy of the Americas. President Juan Bordaberry has remained in office only by ceding a large measure of his...
docs.lead_paragraph: Uruguay has emerged from its worst political crisis in four decades with heavy damage to the democratic system that was once the pride and envy of the Americas. President Juan Bordaberry has remained in office only by ceding a large measure of his constitutional power to military leaders who assert the right to select key Cabinet members as well as to chart drastic reforms to cope with corruption, inflation,
docs.abstract: ed on political crisis in Uruguay asserts Pres Bordaberry has remained in office only by ceding many constitutional powers to military leaders; says long-overdue reforms are impossible with current bureaucracy; notes irony in fact that military leaders brought into internal war against Tupamaro guerrillas by Pres Bordaberry now recognize Uruguayan defects exploited by Tupamaros; says civilians, not military, can bring about needed reforms

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO -- In the end, many people wondered if there had been a military coup or not. The armed forces rebelled against the Government last week in a confrontation which seriously threatened the country's democratic institutions.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO -- In the end, many people wondered if there had been a military coup or not. The armed forces rebelled against the Government last week in a confrontation which seriously threatened the country's democratic institutions.
docs.abstract: review of military rebellion against Uruguayan Pres Bordaberry's Govt; illus

headline.main: Nothing to Do With The People; Uruguay
